p.codeblock: struct AudioVolumeInfo { uid_t uid; unsigned int volume; unsigned int vad; const char * channelId; };
export interface AudioVolumeInfo { uid: number, volume: number vad: number channelId: string }

pd.p:
User ID.
In the local user's callback, uid = 0.
In the remote users' callback, uid is the ID of a remote user whose instantaneous volume is one of the three highest.

plentry.pd: The volume of the user. The value ranges between 0 (lowest volume) and 255 (highest volume). If the user calls , the value of volume is the volume after audio mixing.

pd.p:
Voice activity status of the local user.
0: The local user is not speaking.
1: The local user is speaking.

ul.li: The vad parameter does not report the voice activity status of remote users. In the remote users' callback, the value of vad is always 0.
To use this parameter, you must set report_vad to when calling .

plentry.pd: The name of the channel where the user is in.
